I WANT BUGFREE SOFTWARE>. WHINEWHINEWHINE.  Keeeep dreamin friend. :P
Dumb question of the evening:  How do I mount a physical disk under KVM without breaking everything?
can you be more precise about what you want to do ?
I'm building a Windows XP virtual machine to create an audio server via shoutcast.  I would like this virtual machine to read the mp3s i have on a physical ext3 drive on the host machine.
ok, then use samba to share them. Windows XP won't read them on it's own if it's ext3.
Doh.. I was hoping KVM had a middle-man software to convert to NTFS/Fat32 on the fly.
guess Samba is the answer -- I just hope the loopback network interface doesn't cause issues for streaming audio.
nope, samba is your way here... or get an icecast/shoutcast server for ubuntu?
the shoutcast/icecast servers I found are.. unimpressive.
Thanks though. guess I'll have to go dig into some samba manuals and figure out how the heck to make that fly right.
while we're on the subject -- do you have any recommendations to create samba shares with a mimimum of hassle?
I did try that under PPC and it damn near took out the system.  Is it stabler under x86/x86_64?
not sure... I've always just used the manpage and vim to edit samba configs.
